summary: The `patched()` function always returns true inside signal handlers, causing all workflows to use the new signal flow instead of respecting version compatibility. This was a bug in SDK version 1.8.0-1.8.5 that prevented proper A/B testing of workflow changes.
userImpact: Users deploying workflow changes with signal modifications cannot safely roll out new versions without affecting existing workflow instances.
rootCause: A bug in the patched() implementation when called within signal handlers that caused it to always evaluate to true regardless of the patch ID or workflow history.
workaround: Upgrade to SDK version 1.8.6 or later where the bug was fixed.
resolutionDetails: Fixed in SDK version 1.8.6 as part of a broader patching system fix.
keyQuote: I think you are most likely hitting a bug that was fixed in 1.8.5 (see #1234). Can you please try this with TS SDK v1.11.3?
